pages.description: $(italic)Hematite is the oldest$(br)known iron oxide$(br)mineral that has ever$(br)formed on earth, and$(br)is widespread in rocks$(br)and soils.$()

$(italic)Limonite is an iron$(br)ore consisting of a$(br)mixture of hydrated$(br)iron(III) oxide-$(br)hydroxides in varying composition.$()$(br2)Limonite here is a combination of iron and nickel deposits lying deep in the earth.
